intro: Polygonum fistulosum, commonly known as the slender knotweed, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to temperate regions of Asia. It features upright stems that are often hollow and covered with fine hairs. The leaves are alternate, lance-shaped, and have a slightly serrated margin. Small, greenish-white flowers are clustered in dense inflorescences, and the plant produces small, three-lobed seeds. It is often found in moist environments such as stream banks and wet meadows.
